name: FAMD
description: This tools uses the R software to run exploratory factor analysis for mixed data (FAMD)

inputParams.name: Input_Table
inputParams.description: A table with attributes corresponding to qualitative and/or quantitative variables.
inputParams.label: Input Units Shapefile

inputParams.name: Quantitative_Variables
inputParams.description: Select one or more quantitative variables from the input table.
inputParams.label: Quantitative Variables (comma-separated)

inputParams.name: Qualitative_Variables
inputParams.description: Select one or more qualitative variables from the input table
inputParams.label: Qualitative Variables (comma-separated)

inputParams.name: Supplementary_Quantitative_Variables
inputParams.description: Select one or more supplementary quantitative variables from the input table.
inputParams.label: Supplementary Quantitative Variables (comma-separated)

inputParams.name: Supplementary_Qualitative_Variables
inputParams.description: Select one or more supplementary qualitative variables from the input table.
inputParams.label: Supplementary Qualitative Variables (comma-separated) (optional)

inputParams.name: Compute_Missing_Values
inputParams.description: If checked. missing values are replaced using PCA (for quantitative only datasets), MCA (for qualitative only datasets), or FAMD (for mixed qualitative and quantitative datasets) imputation. When unchecked, missing values are replaced by their column average.
inputParams.label: Compute Missing Values

inputParams.name: Number_of_Dimensions
inputParams.description: Number of dimensions kept in the results.
inputParams.label: Number of Dimensions

inputParams.name: Color_Plots_By
inputParams.description: String corresponding to the color which are used.Quantitative-only dataset: If "none", no color is used for the individuals; if "ind", a color for each individual ("ind"); if "var", color the individuals based on a categorical variable.Qualitative-only dataset: . If "none", one color is used for the individual, another one for the categorical variables; if "quali", one color is used for each categorical variables; if "var", colors are used according to the different categories of a categorical variableFor mixed-data: If "none", no color is used for the individuals; if "ind", one color is used for each individual; if "var", colors are used according to the different categories of a categorical variable
inputParams.label: Color Plots By (optional)

inputParams.name: Categorical_Variable
inputParams.description: When "var" is selected, this name corresponds to that of a categorical variable selected from the input table. The variable will be used to color final plots according to its different levels/categories.
inputParams.label: Categorical Variable (optional)

inputParams.name: Individuals_Selection
inputParams.description: A selection of the individuals that are drawn: "coord N": select the N elements that have the highest (squared) coordinates on the 2 first dimensions drawn"contrib N": select the N elements that have the highest contribution on the 2 first dimensions drawn"cos2 N": select the N elements that have the highest cos2 on the 2 dimensions drawn"dist N": select the N elements that have the highest distance to the center of gravity
inputParams.label: Individuals Selection (optional)

inputParams.name: Categories_Selection
inputParams.description: A selection of the categories that are drawn: "coord N": select the N elements that have the highest (squared) coordinates on the 2 first dimensions drawn"contrib N": select the N elements that have the highest contribution on the 2 first dimensions drawn"cos2 N": select the N elements that have the highest cos2 on the 2 dimensions drawn"dist N": select the N elements that have the highest distance to the center of gravity
inputParams.label: Categories Selection (optional)

inputParams.name: Add_Label_to_Individuals
inputParams.description: When checked, individuals drawn on the plot are labelled.
inputParams.label: Add Label to Individuals (optional)
